locations.name: The Shire
locations.description: A peaceful and idyllic region inhabited by Hobbits, known for its lush greenery and rural charm.
locations.background_story: The Shire is the homeland of the Hobbits, largely secluded from the affairs of the world, and is known for its quiet and simple life.
notable_events: The departure of Frodo Baggins on his journey to destroy the One Ring.

key_features.name: Hobbiton
key_features.description: The central village in the Shire, home to Frodo and Bilbo Baggins.

key_features.name: Bag End
key_features.description: The hobbit hole of Bilbo and later Frodo Baggins, located in Hobbiton.

locations.name: Rivendell
locations.description: An Elven haven, a sanctuary of peace and beauty led by Elrond.
locations.background_story: Rivendell is one of the last Elven refuges in Middle-earth, known for its healing powers and as a place of council.
notable_events: The Council of Elrond where the fate of the One Ring was decided.
The healing of Frodo after being stabbed by a Morgul blade.

key_features.name: The Last Homely House
key_features.description: The residence of Elrond, serving as a refuge for Elves and travelers.

key_features.name: Council of Elrond
key_features.description: A significant meeting held to discuss the fate of the One Ring.

locations.name: Mordor
locations.description: The dark land ruled by Sauron, characterized by its volcanic terrain and the towering fortress of Barad-dûr.
locations.background_story: Mordor is a desolate land where Sauron forged the One Ring and gathered his armies. It is synonymous with evil and darkness.
notable_events: The forging of the One Ring in Mount Doom.
The destruction of the One Ring, leading to the fall of Sauron.

key_features.name: Barad-dûr
key_features.description: Sauron's Dark Tower, a symbol of his power and control.

key_features.name: Mount Doom
key_features.description: The volcanic mountain where the One Ring was forged and where it must be destroyed.

locations.name: Gondor
locations.description: A kingdom of Men, known for its strong fortifications and key role in the fight against Sauron.
locations.background_story: Gondor is one of the last great kingdoms of Men, always standing as a bastion against the darkness of Mordor.
notable_events: The coronation of Aragorn as King of Gondor.

key_features.name: Minas Tirith
key_features.description: The capital city of Gondor, known for its white walls and the seat of Denethor.

key_features.name: Osgiliath
key_features.description: A strategically important city of Gondor, once the capital before being abandoned.

locations.name: Rohan
locations.description: A kingdom of horsemen, known for its vast plains and strong cavalry.
locations.background_story: Rohan is a land of vast fields and plains, where its people, the Rohirrim, are famed for their cavalry.
notable_events: The Ride of the Rohirrim to aid Gondor.

key_features.name: Edoras
key_features.description: The capital of Rohan, home to the ruling king Théoden.

key_features.name: Helm's Deep
key_features.description: A fortress in Rohan, known for its defense during the Battle of Helm's Deep.

locations.name: Isengard
locations.description: A stronghold of Saruman, once a peaceful place but transformed into a fortress for his dark schemes.
locations.background_story: Isengard was originally a fortress of Gondor, but it was handed over to Saruman, who turned it into a place of industry and war.

key_features.name: Orthanc
key_features.description: The black tower at the center of Isengard, where Saruman dwelled.

key_features.name: The Deeping Wall
key_features.description: The fortifications of Isengard that were transformed for war.

locations.name: Lothlórien
locations.description: A magical Elven realm known for its beauty and timeless nature, ruled by Galadriel and Celeborn.
locations.background_story: Lothlórien is a mystical realm where time seems to stand still, and its inhabitants live in harmony with nature.
notable_events: The Fellowship's rest in Lothlórien after Gandalf's fall.
The gifting of the Elven cloaks and other items to the Fellowship.

key_features.name: Caras Galadhon
key_features.description: The central city of Lothlórien, known for its graceful trees and Elven architecture.

key_features.name: The Mallorn Trees
key_features.description: Ancient trees that grow in Lothlórien, adding to its ethereal beauty.

locations.name: Moria
locations.description: An ancient Dwarf kingdom, now overrun by Orcs and known for its vast underground halls.
locations.background_story: Moria was once the greatest of Dwarf kingdoms, rich in Mithril, but it fell to ruin after the awakening of the Balrog.

key_features.name: Khazad-dûm
key_features.description: The great Dwarf city, rich in history and now inhabited by Balrogs and Orcs.

key_features.name: The Bridge of Khazad-dûm
key_features.description: The famous bridge where Gandalf faced the Balrog.
